response.answer_text: The three biggest legacies for John Adams were his defending the British soldiers at the Boston Massacre trial, showing that the rule of law is very important. The next item would be his push for independence, he was helping Jefferson write it. And Finallly he was the one that saw the need to have George Washington as commander of the Continental Army- which would tie the Virginia planter class to the Revolution

If you really want the answer to this, read his biography by David McCullough. It is the most stimulating 1000 pages you’ll ever read. You will also have a newfound respect for the second president of the United States. He was truly a remarkable man.
